intro: Luetzelburgia andina, commonly known as the Andean luetzelburgia, is a flowering plant native to the high Andes of South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its erect, branching stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils at elevations above 3,000 meters. Luetzelburgia andina is adapted to the harsh environmental conditions of the Andean region, including strong sunlight and cold temperatures.
